body.label: T-S 12.9 recto
body.value:
1. (1-2) Proceedings that took place in our presence, etc. Whereas there came to our attention the state of affairs in our beloved and esteemed community in al-Maḥalla the protected,

  2.  

  3. may God bless them and keep them, plant among them love, fraternity, peace and friendship

  4. and remove from their midst jealousy, hatred, and contention, and protect them with His abundant mercy

  5. and lovingkindness—and in the other holy congregations situated in the villages

  6. and towns, as follows: the community has become split and a breach has occurred among its members due to the absence of someone to supervise

  7. (7-8) their litig[a]tions and disagreements, a matter that has been disclosed to the gentiles; knowledge of things forbidden and permitted has [w]eakened among them; they have ceased hearing

  8.  

  9. the words of the Torah durin[g] the regular courses and on the holidays and Sabbaths, as had been their usual practice;

  10. and they have also ceased teaching their children and youths about the Torah and commandments and guiding them

  11. toward what is proper and away from what is not. And whereas there appeared

  12. before us some of our coreligionists who alleged that this had come to pass upon the departure of (his) h(onor), g(reatness, and) h(oliness)

  13. (13-14) (our) m(aster) and t(eacher) Joseph ha-Levi the Excellent Ḥaver and that some members of the noble community there had resolved, in accordance with what they believed with conviction to be right

  14.  

  15. [and of their own free will (?)], not to associate with him either in gatherings or in the synagogue, which greatly distressed us:

  16. [When] we, therefore, considered the disorderly condition of this community and the others in the countryside, alon[g] the lines we have mentioned,

  17. it so dis[tress]ed and disturbed us that we had no alternative but to see to

  18. its rectification, since at the present moment we have no suitable person to whom can be handed over the affairs

  19. of such esteemed and illustrious communities—may God protect them and shelter them

  20. under His wings. While we were looking into this matter, there were also present before us the elder

  21. Abu ’l-Faḍl, and the elders R. so-and-so and R. so-and-so—blessed
